Bustronome Paris.description: Aboard a double-decker bus converted into a restaurant, guests will enjoy a friendly welcome and a wide variety of dishes in a fashionable setting. The BUSTRONOME : a Parisian invitation to rediscover some of the City of Light's most beautiful locations while enjoying fine French cuisine. This singular journey combines a visual experience with a treat for the taste buds; Paris residents and tourists alike can indulge their love of culture while savouring good food.

reviews.title: Amazing experience with fabulous food!
reviews.review_text: Loved this experience, we would highly recommend, food was of amazing standard considering it was made in a small bus kitchen.  Staff were friendly and helpful, sights were great and loved the extra stop by the Eiffel Tower.  There was a five course meal served with wine which included tuna, fish, beef, cheese and desert.  Tips: book in advance especially in busy times, you might need to request a non alcoholic or soft drink (outside of water) as these are not always served as standard, if you run out of wine we were able to request more, staying on after the small break stop is a must because this is when you will get the Eiffel Tower experience.

reviews.title: Sights of Paris and Dinner
reviews.review_text: Fabian and Lea our servers were spectacular. The whole idea of eating and seeing all the sites is just cool. The food was really good. A full 6 courses. They were also very accommodating to my dietary requirements. A wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.review_text: I booked this experience based upon the Frenchies YouTube review as they stated how great the food was and a lovely experience. The poached egg starter and strawberry dessert were good but everything in between was not that great, especially the fish and duck. The duck was overcooked and the fish wasn’t seasoned well. I had just left the Loire Valley and ate at some amazing restaurants and this just didn’t even compare. The wine was also poor. There was a couple seated behind us and I heard the gentleman telling the wait staff that the only good thing was the bread and he told them he didn’t even want the duck brought to the table because the food had been so poor. It is a very jerky experience and I gave up trying to figure out what I was looking at, as my information wasn’t loading. This was a very overpriced, underwhelming experience and I wouldn’t repeat it. It was extremely disappointing to stop at Invalides for pictures, instead of outside the Eiffel Tower.

reviews.title: Paris looks magical from the bus at night
reviews.review_text: great service, great experience, dinner exceeded all expectations, 6 courses of dinner, each one was very tasty.I will visit again.

reviews.title: Fabulous experience
reviews.review_text:
Amazing experience, especially following the Olympic Games

Staff were delightful, food was delicious 

We had a fabulous time, highly recommend

Angelina.description: The Rue de Rivoli tea room is available by phone every day from 9am to 5pm.

reviews.title: Late lunch at Angelina
reviews.review_text: Lunch at Angelina was excellent- we only had to wait for a table for about ten minutes- think we hit a quieter time being after the main lunch time but before the afternoon tea rush! We shared a croque monsiour which was absolutely delicious- and then shared a Mont Blanc- we were glad to have shared both as they are rich and wouldn’t have managed one each. Service was polite and efficient and the decor is well worth seeing.

reviews.title: Go to Laduree instead or chez Caretta
reviews.review_text:
Think of it has a food  factory, 
Worst burger ever with cold fried, Caesar salad with no taste and cold fried chicken . 
Cafeteria atmosphere .

And expensive , service was great.

reviews.title: Definitely Worth a Visit.
reviews.review_text:
Be prepared to queue - we queued for about 30 minutes which wasn't too bad. I would recommend going as early as you can to minimise wait time.

Once inside, the building is beautiful. It really is an experience. It reminded us of Betty's.

We ordered the hot chocolate and the Mont Blanc - we wanted to see what the fuss was about and we weren't disappointed. 

Is it gimmicky? Yes. Is it overpriced? Yes. Is it worth a visit? 100% yes. So, get your sweet tooths ready.

reviews.title: Angelina!
reviews.review_text: The star of the show was, of course, their famous hot chocolate—rich, velvety, and incredibly indulgent. It’s unlike any hot chocolate I’ve ever had, thick enough to be dessert but comforting enough to enjoy on a sunny Parisian afternoon. The service was attentive and gracious, adding to the overall experience of feeling like a guest in a storied Parisian institution. Whether you're stopping by for a luxurious afternoon tea or simply indulging in something sweet, Angelina is a must-visit for anyone in Paris. It’s the perfect spot for a treat.

reviews.title: Goodies in Paris
reviews.review_text: Best desserts ever had. Good quality and excellent service, good coffee and cozy environment. Nice location near my hotel.

Ciel de Paris.address: 33 Avenue Du Maine 56th Floor, Montparnasse Tower, 75015 Paris France
Ciel de Paris.description: Le Ciel de Paris bénéficie d’un panorama exceptionnel sur la ville, avec des vues uniques, changeantes selon l’heure, la lumière et les données climatiques. Un déjeuner ou un dîner au Ciel de Paris, quelles qu’en soient les circonstances, est une expérience singulière dont le souvenir, pour longtemps, s’inscrira dans la mémoire de chacun. Du haut de ses 210 mètres, la vue sur Paris et au-delà - jusqu’à 40 kilomètres par temps clair - y est exceptionnelle.

reviews.title: Bad experience for viettravel
reviews.review_text:
Viettravel airline, Vietnam domestic airline is the worst airlines I have ever encountered. Anyhow cancel flight, no one pick up phone for change booking. 
Worst service attitude esp hotline staff 
Hope tourists read the comments can think twice for booking it.

reviews.title: Bad ! Don’t come here!
reviews.review_text:
This place needs to be closed, renovated, and re staffed.
It is rough around the edges, worn out.
Bathroom looked like it was in the process of demolition.
Male wait staff smelled of body odor so badly that it was almost constant. We were close to gagging at times .
Send your staff home if they smell, don’t bathe or wear dirty clothes!!!!
This is marketed as fine dining, but how can you taste anything beyond the smell of intense body odor?
The food arrived cold and was below average in taste and presentation. Pork chop arrived seared and raw when it was ordered well done.
The music was completely inappropriate for this kind of venue. It was more like a lobby of a cheap hotel.A last  comment… not the fault of the restaurant, but most of the clientele at lunch today were Chinese. They were very loud and rude, making TikTok videos and face timing with loud volume, and encroaching on our personal dining space.
An obviously French couple came in for lunch, sat down, and immediately left because of all of the above.

This could be an awesome venue, but sadly it was a bad experience.
I wish we had bought sandwiches from a deli.

reviews.title: Amazing view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. Excellent Service and very good food.
reviews.review_text:
I was a little apprehensive about this place. Well! Nice surprise! The view is amazing! Right in front of the Eiffel Tower on the 56th floor. I booked at 7:30PM in order to see the sunset. Good decision. The service is excellent! I booked a 145 Euros dinner with wine. It is all you can drink including Moet champagne! Can’t beat that! 
Good food! Good portions!
I highly recommend.

reviews.title: The view was the only positive
reviews.review_text:
The view was stunning, but the service was terrible, and the food tasted of salt, salt and salt.

Add misplaced and missing orders, we canceled dessert and left with no plans to return.

reviews.title: It's worth a visit for the view!
reviews.review_text: Service was lovely, very polite, very helpful, good wine and menu recommendations. Menu had a variety of fish and meat options. We had the 'balcony' menu for €79 per head. View was stunning and even more so at sunset. Main downside was the lack of air conditioning. In 29°C heat, it was sweltering with the sun beaming in. I felt very sorry for the staff who were in full uniform. Food was ok, nothing to shout from the hills about, but certainly satisfying and worth going if for nothing else but the view.

reviews.title: Definitely recommended!!!!
reviews.review_text: I visited with my sister and cousin after hearing about it being really good, I loved the French onion soup here and their famous steak and chips with the sauce! My goodness, it was well worth the wait in line. Bonus points for unlimited chips and sauce! My fav! We went there a few times for dinner on our few days stay in Paris!

reviews.title: Fun experience
reviews.review_text:
Memorable experience! Massive queue to get in as so popular but we just managed to get in as it opened. 
Super efficient and enjoyable time for our family.

reviews.title: It never gets old!
reviews.review_text:
We were introduced to this restaurant by our daughter. She discovered it when she lived in Paris for her Study Abroad time. Back then, we had visited her halfway through her 6 month stay. We weee impressed. I even tried to recreate the meal. But, I always fell short. 

This time l, we came with our SIL and her two daughters. They love a good steak frites. And so, we had our fill. First, the salads came. Then the beef with a mound of perfectly fried julienned potatoes. So addicting. Then there was the sauce on the beef. (Good enough to lick the plate. But, we behaved ourselves.). They thought that was it. But alas! The other half of the steaks came and with fries!  These were being warmed in the kitchen while we finish the first half of our order. After our lunch, it was good to walk on the streets of Paris for the next two hours. Service was efficient and friendly but brisk. That’s ok. We were not looking for a 3 Michelin starred location.

reviews.title: Great place for steak!
reviews.review_text: We loved it! The steak was tender and flavorful, served and kept hot, great salad, good service. We went early, about 6pm, and there was no wait. Nice ambiance and great location.

reviews.title: Good beef
reviews.review_text:
The beef was very good! I don't like the combination with fries but I understand the concept of the restaurant so it's OK. I was there 20 minutes before opening so I got a table very fast.
Overall it was a nice experience!

reviews.title: Amazing Restaurant!
reviews.review_text: Went here with my family in October 2024 for dinner. It was a great experience. Our waiter was lovely, the food and drink superb, the singer was amazing and the views of the Eiffel Tower outside were brilliant. Fantastic classy restaurant and a highlight of our trip to Paris. Easy 5 Stars. Go there!

reviews.title: Pretentious, rude and generally unpleasant.
reviews.review_text:
Gigi was an awful experience -  very, very disappointing. I really would not waste your money there.

We were initially left standing at the entrance as our table wasn't ready.
Eventually (after about 10 minutes) we were led to an awful table next to the waiters 'slops' station (where all the dirty plates and left over food are stacked). It was honestly the worst table in the restaurant.
As there were a number of other tables free, after a few minutes we stood up and asked to be moved. The waiter was incredibly rude to us as we swapped tables.
Having ordered an expensive bottle of Champagne it was frustrating that it was not bought to the table for a long time - in fact the starters were served before any drinks had arrived.
The main course was served cold. When I called the waiter over to say that the food was cold, I was told that 'that was the custom'. It obviously wasn't, and I left the meal. Nobody questioned why the food was left and the full meal was charged.

Paris has far too many fabulous restaurants to waste your time and money here. It really was awful.

reviews.title: Good food
reviews.review_text: We dined outside with a decent view of the Eiffel Tower. While the service was acceptable, our waiter was notably rude to neighboring tables, making unprofessional comments. However, the food and dessert were excellent, and the atmosphere improved as the night went on. We had a good time overall, though we noticed some issues with the staff. When it came time to settle the bill, our waiter appeared to be watching the screen to see the tip amount. Despite these concerns, the dining experience was enjoyable.

reviews.title: Very poor
reviews.review_text:
Here’s your review of **Gigi** in Paris:

---

**Restaurant Name:** Gigi, Paris  
**Rating:** ★★☆☆☆ (2/5)

Gigi in Paris is an Italian restaurant with a fantastic location and an incredible outdoor seating area offering stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. The ambiance outside is definitely one of the highlights. However, the indoor dining area is quite underwhelming and lacks the charm you’d expect from a place like this.
Unfortunately, the food was very disappointing. The pasta was nearly inedible — overcooked and chewy, like chewing gum. When we requested to switch to spaghetti, we were told no. My daughter also struggled with her meal, and her second dish was ruined by an overwhelming amount of garlic. Most of our group couldn’t finish their meals due to poor quality. The house rosé and white wine were equally subpar, leaving us all unimpressed.
Service was another low point. The restaurant was extremely busy, and it felt like the goal was to rush people in and out. We had to queue both to enter and leave via a tiny, 4-person lift, which was frustrating and unacceptable for a restaurant of this caliber. Our waiter was somewhat surly and not accommodating, particularly when we expressed dissatisfaction with the wine.
While the outdoor area with its view of the Eiffel Tower is truly beautiful, the rest of the experience left a lot to be desired. Inside, the ambiance is nothing special, and overall, the restaurant doesn’t have a welcoming or “can-do” attitude.
The view is spectacular, but the rest of the experience at Gigi falls flat. Poor food quality, lackluster service, and an overall rushed feeling make it a place I wouldn’t return to. There are plenty of great dining options in Paris with a view of the Eiffel Tower, and sadly, this isn’t one of them.

---

Let me know if you’d like to adjust anything!

reviews.title: Don’t go if you don’t want to enjoy yourself
reviews.review_text: It was one of the most discriminative experiences of my life. Food wasn’t even that great. But if your not European/or say a person of colour don’t go they were so racist. The server practically chucked the plates of food on the table.

Pizzamore Paris.description: Pizzamore est un restaurant,pizzeria italien situé idéalement dans le quartier de Montparnasse dans le 14eme arrondissement de Paris. Cette pizzeria originale et conviviale offre une expérience gustative 100% italienne : antipasti, pâtes fraîches, pizzas gourmets, et desserts italiens. A deux pas des métros Convention et Montparnasse, nos services en salle, en livraison et à emporter, vous permettront de faire voyager vos papilles tout en restant à Paris.

reviews.title: Good service, good food
reviews.review_text: I love the pasta ! 100/100 omg and the service was so smooth too , they made me felt welcome , thanks to titiana and the slim guy that took my pictures ❤️

reviews.title: Pizzamore 5/5
reviews.review_text: Pizzamore in Paris is such a cozy little spot. The atmosphere is really welcoming, and it feels like the perfect place to just relax and enjoy good food. Their pizzas are amazing—thin crust, fresh ingredients, and so flavorful. They have a nice variety on the menu, so it’s easy to find something you’ll like. The staff is super friendly, which makes the whole experience even better. And if you have room for dessert, the tiramisu is definitely worth trying. It’s a great place to hang out and enjoy some really good pizza.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text:
Delicious food and amazing service! I would recommend!! 
The pasta with seafood was great as well as the wine of the month :)

reviews.title: great dinner
reviews.review_text: The service was very welcoming and the fact that the waitress speaks many languages it’s a plus. Bien sur if I visit Paris again i will be coming back here.

reviews.title: Best Italian Restraint
reviews.review_text: Most amazing Italian I have had. Service was excellent and food was out standing. Fast serving, very helpful people, very good English there’s just nothing I can say bad about this place.

Loulou Restaurant Paris.description: LOULOU a été pensé comme la demeure d’un esthète, la salle à manger d’un collectionneur qui aurait été décorée au fil du temps et au gré de nombreux voyages … Sensible à l’art de vivre et au savoir-vivre, LOULOU reçoit ses amis avec élégance, gaieté et légèreté. Ensemble, ils aiment organiser des déjeuners d’affaires et des dîners extraordinaires. Table à la fois délicate et frivole, on y partage le bon et le beau, de jour comme de nuit, avec sensualité et grâce infinie. Aux beaux jours, on profite de sa terrasse et la fête se poursuit tard dans la nuit.

reviews.title: Disgustingly Rude Staff
reviews.review_text: You can get great food almost anywhere in Paris. Not worth experiencing the terribly rude and unwelcoming staff. Management either condones it or is not aware. Hostess should be the first to be fired. She’s unemployable.

reviews.title: Idyllic location
reviews.review_text:
Ignore reviews stating hard to book I emailed then i followed with a phone call and staff answered straight away called just after midday and managed to book a table for our last night.  Then just had to confirm via email with credit card.
Staff wonderful very friendly excellent customer service.
Drinks amazing the cocktails were rather strong but enjoyable.
Food out of this world my daughter had the Spaghetti al pomodoro & I had the Risotto tomatoes, Sagan,romarin absolutely best meal we have ever eaten.
Definitely recommend to visit and worth every euro.

Thank you for a wonderful evening

reviews.title: BEWARE: Great food but at a cost - bait and switch!
reviews.review_text: We were at the Louve location on a beautiful day. Very elegant and awesome food. BUT, I ordered a glass of red wine, which when i had ordered in other Paris locations never paid more than 5-8 euros. I enjoyed my first glass and ordered another, stupidly assuming it wasnt going to be 35 euros per glass!!!! I almost fell over when the bill cam. The waiter said it was his fault and I should have asked but when i paid he also forced me to give a tip of either 10% or 20% there was no otheroption and quite frankly the waiter was making it embarrassing for us for asking about the wine cost. No where else in either Barcelona or Parisd did this occur and we ate at Michelin rated restaurants multiple times. Beware of the bait and swtich here but enjoy the ambiance. It will be a one and done for this reviewer.

reviews.title: Amazing place
reviews.review_text: The food here was exceptional, complemented by outstanding service from all the staff and a beautiful atmosphere. Although we were seated on the lower floor, the upstairs area had a lively party vibe. We sampled a variety of dishes, each one superb. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely return on our next visit to Paris

reviews.title: Yummy Italian in Paris
reviews.review_text:
Loulou has an amazing location in Paris and shouldn’t be missed- it’s great to got at lunch as the setting is spectacular 2 minute walk from the louvre in the park. Because we were there for lunch on our last day we couldn’t really try everything as we were on a time limit. However the buratta with the peach is spectacular and the pasta with the veal shouldn’t be missed. 

I could sit there for hours and enjoy the view on the second floor.

Alleno Paris.address: 8 avenue Dutuit Pavillon Ledoyen, 75008 Paris France
Alleno Paris.description: On the first floor of the superb néo-classical mansion with many bay windows, Yannick Alléno has established his 3 MICHELIN star restaurant (2021 Michelin Guide), also ranked at The Worlds's 50 Best restaurants. In the both grandiose and intimate room, in which the original frescos have been enrolled at Historical Monuments, each detail has been thoughtfully arranged to ensure an exceptional gastronomic moment. Yannick Alléno proves that he learned close to the best chefs and shows that he has an avant-gardist vision. Extractions® bring sauces up to date, while fermentations invoke products’ specific terroirs, and each course delicately unfolds. Every dish is structured, well-presented and skilfully researched. The whole meal is a remarkable demonstration of Yannick Alléno’s uniquely creative and uncompromising approach.

reviews.title: 3 Michelin with a few hiccups in the beginning but finished it with a bang
reviews.review_text: A few days before our arrival to the restaurant the manager asked us what food we liked and they customized the menu. As we sat to our table the manager gave us the menu. At first it had our names on the menu but  it wasn’t the menu we requested. Having 3 stars we thought everything would be perfect and this mistake of not getting the menu right was a disaster. So they had to step up their game and the chef plus the manager had to make sure we were served with extra attention. In the end the food was fantastic. The flavors plate presentation and the desserts were not sweet. I had to shake the hand of the chef and told him good job shook his hand and thanked the crew

reviews.title: Read reviews and Reach into your Pocketbook
reviews.review_text: You can look at my many reviews on Trip Advisor and see that I usually give good reviews.  I hesitated reviewing Alleno b/c the service we received was top notch and impeccable.  The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful, and I thoroughly enjoyed dining in a nice restaurant with classy service.  I know everyone has different taste, but my husband and I did not enjoy the food at all.  The grouse that he tried was basically raw.  If you're going to spend the amount of money we spent, make sure you read reviews first.  It may be more palatable to others, but it was not for us.

reviews.title: Adorable place and unique food
reviews.review_text: It was an outstanding night. My first time in Paris and with a unique experience. I was delighted with each detail since the decoration, localization to the tastes. The personalization in the menu with our names and all the care made the night.

reviews.title: Amazing and worth the planning to get in.
reviews.review_text: Lived up to the hype.  Amazing venue.  Great pace of meal.  No dead spaces.  Staff and sommelier was fantastic.  Great menu with some chances and they paid off.  A meal to remember during an amazing trip. We experienced the Three Michelin stars.

reviews.title: Charming restaurant - perfect for a dinner date
reviews.review_text: We love delicious and beautiful food and this is what you get at Alleno.  We noticed though that the chef used gel on many of the meals. It might have been the theme but we didn’t quite enjoy it except for the salad. Service is excellent; our server was attentive but alas, forgot to send the candles used our celebratory dessert.  The dining room is exquisitely charming - Perfect for our dinner date.  Great to experience dining here only once.

Au Vieux Paris.description: Au Vieux Paris restaurant in the very heart of Paris, on the Ile de la Cite not two steps from Notre Dame, has history and gastronomy in its favour. Patrons Odette and Georges bring their seasonal ingredients each week from the finest organic farms in the Aveyron in southern France to create dishes like warm foie gras, duck breast a l���orange, and other classics. The restaurant is sited in an Canon���s residence constructed in 1512 and the d��cor ��� brilliantly over the top ��� reflects history in every detail, the heavily figured scarlet wallpaper and tented ceilings, the antique prints, the exposed stonework and rich draperies. Au Vieux Paris is terribly romantic - you���ll even have to stroll by the Seine to get home.

reviews.title: A wonderfully pleasant surprise!
reviews.review_text: Absolutely our best dining experience during our stay in Paris this year. We have been vacationing in Paris in November for the past 24 years and I just wish we would have discovered this sooner. The atmosphere was as charming as the food was delicious.

reviews.title: A wonderful, quirky, and charming experience.
reviews.review_text:
We spotted this restaurant by accident as I was navigating around the back streets of Ile de la cite with my husband.  We stopped to take photos of it's charming facade when a man offered to take some for us, with us in them. Turns out it was the owner, and he offered us a peek inside the very historic building. Wow what a gobsmacker!
We booked for dinner and were treated to sensational meals around oddly shaped tables (which is great) downstairs.  It is a 'choose your own' cellar, so my husband went and picked what he wanted.   It is a VERY old building so don't ex[pect large open spaces or modern decor.  It was wonky, charming, and decorated to the max in florid french style.  Gorgeous.   I absolutely loved it.  The food was great, but the atmosphere and the fun and rambunctious owner really made the atmosphere the stand out.   People talk together, over tables, sit at tables together, or separately, it's very 'as you see it'.   Prices are medium high, as you would expect.  it was our 30th Wedding anniversary, and we couldn't have picked better.
To top it off, a wonderful young man who was part of the Notre Dame choir, and in furlow until Notre Dame is open again, sang some beautiful french songs unaccompanied for the patrons at the restaurant.  Hauntingly beuatiful, it was just enchanting and his voice superb.  We will never forget the singer, and are really grateful he allowed us all to hear him sing, between his food courses!!
Wonderful.   REcommend.
Thankyou, Monsieur for your hospitality.

reviews.title: Not for TOURISTS - This was an intense FRENCH experience - With Singing...
reviews.review_text:
Insanely close to Notre Dame, this is not a tourist restaurant – If you are a tourist, go elsewhere. I was the only non-French person there that night. The owner is friendly and gently mocked my Englishness – A good start. There is no wine list – You go to the cellar and choose your own bottle – Starting from 25 Euros – Much cheaper that in the UK.
The owner told me what to have and it was the Best Beef Bourguignon I have experienced – And I make it myself! My companions had the pork medallions - pretty, moist and flavoursome and Confit du canard – falling off the bone and rich.
We started with snails – My only criticism was the snail wranglers were not quite fit for purpose so extracting our garlicy friends was a bit of a challenge.
We shared deserts – The chocolate bombe – spot on, and their version of Tart Tartine – more like a slice of apple pizza with flaky pastry – Light, crisp and subtly wonderful.
This is not a tourist restaurant.
And later – SINGING by the piano as the diners gathered around and joined in. So special.
Recommended for real and romantic people. Don’t go if you are a perfectionist or a cynic.

reviews.title: Maybe my 8th time here, not my last
reviews.review_text:
I always try to visit the fantastic people of this place, when I am in Paris.
It is not pish, but it is nice and with a fantastic staff....
Go see for your self, why I love this place, their style, their wine cellar.
The toilets could be bigger and better - but then you have something to work on....
Reccomadation: their hot Foie Gras, it is made to engel songs....

reviews.title: Please Go Anywhere Else
reviews.review_text: I know it seems approachable for tourists and it’s close to Norte Dame, but skip it. All the food was sub par and the wine was overpriced. It’s the only meal we had in Paris that wasn’t phenomenal and I regret the recommend by Les Frenchies.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE
reviews.review_text: Worst Place I’ve ever been to!!!!!!!! Went here for my partners birthday meal which we was really excited for as over social media it looks good however my partner asked for a virgin moito as he can not have alcohol because religion, they gave him it with gin in which obviously he drank without knowing it has alcohol in. Absolutely appalling to make this mistake, the manager tried sorting it and said she’ll leave us a present which ment taking 2 drinks off the bill which STILL come to €270 SHOCKING!!!!!! DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY PS we had 3 drinks 2 dishes of pasta a they charge us for water ! Absolute joke!!!!!!!

reviews.title: César is a vibe
reviews.review_text:
Great service, flavorful food and a beautiful ambience. The playlist was a whole vibe as well - very diverse and upbeat. I got the king crab and hubby got the black ravioli pasta - a first for him and for a picky eater he was impressed.
So I did well as we continue his birthday celebration.

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.review_text: This restaurant was great! Our food was amazing I had the truffle ravioli! The service was great, the waiters were really friendly! The atmosphere was great too they had a DJ in the back. We loved the look of the place too.

reviews.title: I recommended this restaurant
reviews.review_text: Fresh food and friendly and beautiful staffs and also delicious pizza and amazing  pasta and clean restaurant and nice view

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.review_text:
We saw this restaurant over social media due to their visits by celebrities. When people say, don’t trust celebrities reviews, this is one of those situations.

The restaurant itself is quite nice and has a good vibe however the food was terrible. I got the cheese wheel pasta, it is simply plain pasta with melted cheese on. My friend had the bolognese which was just standard bolognese. 

If you’re British, I’ve genuinely had better food at a hungry horse. Honestly, save your money and go to McDonald’s because it’s a lot better. 

This would be fine, if the bill didn’t come to €103 for two pasta dishes and two drinks 😟

The customer service wasn’t anything out of the ordinary, wasn’t good, wasn’t bad either. 

Also, I suppose it doesn’t have anything to do with the restaurant itself, but a man attempted to mug me right outside of the restaurant and then walked into the restaurant to be served.

Paris Las Vegas.address: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
Paris Las Vegas.description: Experience everything you love about Paris, in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. The city of lights shine on the strip. One night with us is all it takes to realize everything's sexier in Paris. Give in to your every desire at Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino, whether you crave decadent dining, world-class entertainment or thrilling nightlife. Guest rooms at Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino have a distinctly chic European look, with Versailles-style fixtures and luxury romantic décor. Red Rooms are sophisticated and modern while the splurge-worthy Louis XV Suite features chandeliers and oversized bathtubs.
Paris Las Vegas.address_string: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

reviews.title: Terrible front desk , terrible customer service
reviews.review_text: Terrible customer service, terrible communication, let’s just start with the checkin it’s about 2 hours because they had like 6 desk workers an it was the day before thanksgiving, the kiosks don’t work we had prepaid, upon checking in we discovered that one of the rooms we paid for an resort fees etc. the tv doesn’t work so I call the front desk an was told someone would come up an work on it  , ok, so I’m in bed about 12:30 to 1:00 am an the worker shows up takes tv off wall , unplugs it etc. then informs me that he will have to send the tv crew up next day , well the next day I call front desk again an they say someone will come up , so we leave an go to thanksgiving buffet at Wynn , upon coming back some 4 or 5 hours later still no tv , call front desk 2 more times, finally the next day the front desk says if you wanna talk to management you must come downstairs you can’t talk on phone, so I go an I’m kinda out off at the front desk because the lady I walk up to shuts her stand down an walks in a door behind the counter, I ask the other lady on duty is she telling the manager or what , she mumbled something , anyway the manager finally comes out , April was her name she says yes I see where you called multiple times an we have sent 5 engineers up an none of them could fix it , my reply was can’t you just put a new tv in , anyway she says we can swap rooms which was a huge ordeal moving everything, no help offered, she says I can take off the resort fees she that’s like $200 plus so I say ok,  upon checkout today , another lady says only taking off $56 that’s it , no communication, nothing, we spend over $2500 on motel fees , this property has declined bad , read the other reviews, you will see I lot of the people saying the same thing, carpet is old, worn, nasty, we will be taking our business away from ceasers properties, Paris is only out to get your $$

reviews.title: Disappointing Experience at a Supposedly Four-Star Hotel
reviews.review_text:
1.	No Basic Amenities: The room lacked a coffee or tea maker, bottled water, and other basic conveniences you’d expect at this price point.
	2.	Horrible Check-In Process: We waited over an hour to check in, only to be met with a rude staff member who dismissed complaints by stating, “I’m tired too.”
	3.	Dead Door Lock Battery: One day, we couldn’t access our room because the battery in the door lock was dead. Reaching the front desk was impossible due to the endless line. After waiting for security and management, it took over an hour to resolve.
	4.	Broken Safe: The in-room safe didn’t work, requiring us to wait 60 minutes for management to arrive and fix it.
	5.	Housekeeping Issues: Our room was not cleaned two out of the five days we stayed. On the second day, we requested clean towels and soap to at least take a shower and waited 90 minutes for them to be delivered.

Overall, the lack of organization, poor service, and absence of basic amenities made this an incredibly frustrating stay. I would not recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Not what it used to be
reviews.review_text:
Our first room was not acceptable. We found gum on the bathroom counter and the room had a funky smell. That room also had the tiniest pillows on the two queen beds. After I complained, the second room was ok. But Atleast it had better pillows.

Checked out a couple days later and realized they charged me for refreshments I never ordered or purchased. Overall, the experience was annoying and an inconvenience.

reviews.title: Irresponsible
reviews.review_text: First of all, we pay waay more to stay at the Versailles room and there is not even a fridge. My friends/family stayed at the Bordeaux, and they had a better view plus fridge.  On 11/03/2023, I made a reservation through Booking.com. However, when I arrived at the hotel -on my wedding day- I was informed that my reservation had been canceled. I did not receive any cancellation notice via email, which felt very weird. I had a makeup appointment at 5 PM, and until 4:45 PM, I was stuck on the lobby, trying to figure this out each out. It was incredibly distressing to stand in the hotel lobby, in tears and embarrassed, while all my guests were waiting. I was left with no choice but to rebook a room for over $900 of difference of the original price just to avoid missing my own wedding. And then I was told by Booking that they did not cancel ANYTHING, they are not allowed to do it without the costumer authorization and clearly it was not the case.  Do NOT stay in this hotel!!

reviews.title: Versailles is a nice remodel, but add something for your toiletries in the shower
reviews.review_text:
We stayed in the new Versailles tower for 4 nights in mid November.   We had a room very near the top floor with a great view of the Eiffel Tower.  

The room has been newly renovated and was quite nice.  The room was quite large and spacious. The bed and pillows were comfortable.  There was not a mini fridge but they provided one for us.  There is a mini bar with items for purchase! 

The bathroom was also nicely remodelled. Of note, and I hope that CET takes note, there is no where in the shower to place your toiletries but on the base of the shower floor.  They really should rectify this.    The water pressure wasn't amazing but we always had more than enough hot water.

Housekeeping was very nice and came on the days we requested. 

The new skybridge connecting the new Versailles tower to Paris was opened. The area is beautiful imo.  If you are on the second level by the room elevators and walk to the Paris hotel through the skybridge, you can be on the casino floor in 3 minutes.  If you are coming from your room this would def be much quicker then walking into the Horseshoe casino and through the regular walk-way.  That wasn't a hindrance to us - it was quite quick.

We were dropped off and checked in at the Horseshoe. This was very quick and easy. We also had no issues using their diamond lounge.

I will be honest, I think they should have left the tower with Horseshoe, but the remodel was very nice and if you like Horseshoe, it's like you are staying there :)

Would 100% stay here again.

Ritz Paris.description: Located on the iconic Place Vendôme, the Ritz Paris is one of the most legendary hotels in the City of Lights. Refinement of French art de vivre meets elegance of Belle Époque décor. Exquisitely appointed 71 rooms and 71 suites bear the name of F. Scott Fitzgerald or Marcel Proust. Ritz Paris is a place where dreams come to life. The famous Bar Vendôme welcomes guests to savor dishes at any hour of the day while the Ritz Bar is the perfect place to enjoy zodiac-themed cocktails. Ritz Paris Le Comptoir celebrates modern conviviality and French gourmandise, with exceptional pastries by Chef François Perret. At the École Ritz Escoffier, enthusiasts, from novice to professional, can perfect their approach to French cuisine and pastry-making. The Ritz Club & Spa and its sumptuous pool elevates well-being to an art form. Last but not least, Salon Proust is the place to enjoy a delightful teatime à la française and no visit to the Ritz Paris would be complete without stopping by the iconic Bar Hemingway.

reviews.title: Doorman doesn’t know what “hospitality” means
reviews.review_text:
We were hoping to come in and have lunch at the cafe in the lobby, but the employee who was standing just inside the revolving doors was on us the second we entered, asking why we were there and making sure we knew we weren’t allowed to go any further into the hotel. We had been out walking all day and weren’t wearing head to toe fur coats or carrying Louis Vuitton bags, so he clearly knew we weren’t good enough to be in the building and wanted to make sure to keep out the riffraff.

Plenty of other people walked by without his comment, their noses in the air, and that of course was no problem to the doorman because those people clearly belonged. It’s ironic that a space that ought to exist to make people feel welcome instead does the opposite. Stuffy, “exclusive” Parisian hotel culture at its worst.

reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
reviews.review_text:
This was my first stay at the Ritz, but it won’t be my last. Every staff member that I encountered was professional but friendly and made me feel quite welcomed. 

One of the great perks of a stay at the Ritz is that your room is ready when you arrive, regardless of the time (as long as you let them know your arrival time in advance).  Many flights from the US arrive quite early in the morning, so this was a huge plus for me. It is also possible to delay check out until 3 pm on your day of departure. 

I have already booked a second stay for January 2025

reviews.title: Beautiful place but food only average
reviews.review_text: Had lunch in the Ritz on Monday after Arc weekend.. Nice table in garden room.. very good Regnard wine.. we ordered 2 Croque Monsieur and  a chicken Caesar Salad.. the service was very good.. polite, friendly and professional... the food was a let down, unfortunately.. it was well presented and in a timely fashion.. but the salad was lacking in taste and flavour.. the Croque was described as average by those who ate it.. cocktails after lunch were lovely... it was a pity about the food.. fabulous place though.. our wine waiter, Axel, was the epitome of French charm at it's best..

reviews.title: Chapter and Verse of Comfort
reviews.review_text: As a bookworm, I was in heaven. Each floor was themed after a different literary genre, with quotes adorning the walls and books available to borrow everywhere. The cozy reading nooks scattered throughout were perfect for losing oneself in a story. The staff, well-versed in literature, were always ready with a recommendation. It was a bibliophile's dream come true!

reviews.title: Epitome of parisian luxury
reviews.review_text:
This hotel is truly in a league of its own. The concierge service deserves special mention - their knowledge and efficiency were outstanding. They anticipated our needs and made excellent recommendations that enhanced our Paris experience.
the attention to detail throughout the hotel is remarkable. from the exquisitely appointed rooms to the flawless service in every interaction, the ritz maintains its reputation as an icon of luxury hospitality.
While the stay was short, the memories will last a lifetime. for those seeking the pinnacle of parisian luxury, the ritz paris delivers an unforgettable experience that justifies its legendary status. truly a 5-star gem in every sense.

Le Bristol Paris.address: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
Le Bristol Paris.description: Faubourg Saint Honoré, au cœur du Paris de la mode, Le Bristol Paris écrit son histoire depuis 1925. Elle nous raconte l’élégance de son décor entièrement rénové, agrémenté de meubles XVIIIe, l’audace des soirées Bristol After Dark qui revisitent les codes des nuits parisiennes, la maitrise d’un service alliant art, chaleur et grand professionnalisme. Brasserie une étoile ou table triplement étoilée, nos Chefs subliment la gastronomie française. De l’extraordinaire piscine suspendue au-dessus des toits, aux 1200 m2 de verdure et de calme de son jardin intérieur, Le Bristol est un Palace unique où l’on se sent bien.
Le Bristol Paris.address_string: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France

reviews.title: A unique place to stay in Paris
reviews.review_text: First and foremost: the staff is outstanding.  The building is incredible; the elevator, the pool, the garden, every single space is unique.  Very well located.  Expensive, but worth very much the stay.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.review_text: The incredibly smooth, friendly, and professional staff exceeded our expectations every day with their kindness and flawless teamwork and service. We were delighted with the little snacks and gifts placed in our room daily. The porters, room valet, room service, and concierge staff was perfect. Our check-in/check-out service was easy and pleasant. We were walked to our room when we checked in. The room was beautiful, the shower/water-pressure was amazing, huge fluffy white towels, comfortable bed. I wish we had time to experience the pool and spa.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.review_text: Wonderful service, beautiful hotel, the breakfast was awesome. It was an unforgettable experience of lifetime.

reviews.title: Hello Paris!
reviews.review_text: Great location, friendly service excellent housekeeping, overall a great experience! Definitely the best hotel in town.

reviews.title: Hotel Heaven
reviews.review_text: Once again another fabulous stay at Le Bristol! If heaven has a hotel this would be it. Every detail in the room from the bed to the towels is perfect. The concierge team is outstanding , they took care of all of our dining and tours. The staff is so friendly and sincere can't wait to return again.

Novotel Paris Les Halles.address: 8 Place Marguerite de Navarre, 75001 Paris France
Novotel Paris Les Halles.description: Notre hôtel se rénove et évolue pour sublimer votre expérience ! Chaque changement est pensé avec soin pour vous garantir un séjour agréable, dans un cadre confortable et accueillant. Équipées d'une télévision à écran plat, d'une climatisation et d'un minibar, les chambres du Novotel Paris Les Halles offrent tout le confort dont vous avez besoin. Vous pourrez même rester connecté grâce au wi-fi gratuit. L'hôtel dispose de nombreux atouts, tels qu'un service de chambre et une conciergerie. Le centre de fitness et le petit déjeuner contribueront à rendre votre séjour encore plus spécial. Que vous soyez en voyage d'affaires, d'agrément ou les deux, le Novotel Paris Les Halles rendra votre séjour à Paris inoubliable.
Novotel Paris Les Halles.address_string: 8 Place Marguerite de Navarre, 75001 Paris France
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center
Free Wired Internet in the Business Center

reviews.title: A great stay, lovely staff!!
reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful stay at the Novotel les Halles. The staff were incredibly attentive to us, from the moment we arrived with the help of the bellboy to the young woman at reception (Helena, I believe) who checked us in. Everything was perfect. The highlight was the concierge, Fabrice, who assisted us when we had an issue with our flight tickets. He took a lot of time to help us, and it truly saved the rest of our trip – thank you! The hotel is undergoing some construction on the ground floor, but it didn't affect our stay as we weren’t disturbed in our room, and the staff were so kind that we didn’t mind at all. The location is very central, allowing us to get everywhere quickly. It was a fantastic experience, and we will definitely return here every time we visit Paris!

reviews.title: We can’t sleep because of bad services.
reviews.review_text: Aircon is not working.  Telephone is not working. We spend two (2) nights without sleep because of a very hot room. We reported the issue on the receptionist twice.  They just promised to fix it never done anything. Me and my wife are very frustrated.  We don’t recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very  professional personal, very well placed, nearby everything, I’ll come back for sure!!!
reviews.review_text: Excellent, specially personal of the Hotel, particularly Paulo such a nice man, continuously worry about any need that we have, he helped us in many ways. Hope in my next visit all the amenities are set, like restaurant, the entrance, breakfast used to be better when I visited it in 2022, best regards to all the personal they’re the best!

reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Paris
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel in the heart of my favorite district of Paris! Convenient location (close to train, shopping, restaurants) yet quiet and charming. Breakfast was lovely, well stocked in-room coffee/tea, friendly staff, very clean hotel that is well maintained (elevators fast!)

reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff but currently baorded up as being renovated.
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a month long trip. Great location and as per other reviews the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, we were unaware that the hotel is currently being renovated. The front is all boarded up and the outdoor courtyard is not available. As a result there is no natural light coming into the hotel. When we arrived security had to come out and get us as they obviously saw we could not find the entrance. We didn't enjoy our stay as it felt dark and pokey.

The Peninsula Paris.description: Exquisitely restored spaces are complemented by contemporary art installations, furnishings and technology. Dazzling rooftop spaces and private terrace gardens offer 360° views and glamorous extras that make The Peninsula Paris a decidedly 21st century palace.As with all Peninsula Hotels, location is of prime importance and Paris is no exception. Just steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and Avenue des Champs Elysées at 19 Avenue Kléber in the heart of the elegant 16th arrondissement, The Peninsula sits close to some of the world’s most famous monuments, museums and luxury shopping districts.
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center
Photo Copier / Fax In Business Center

reviews.title: Tranquil Luxury in Every Detail
reviews.review_text: Stepping into this hotel felt like entering a peaceful oasis. The sophisticated decor and calming atmosphere instantly melted away our travel stress. The beds were heavenly comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were top-notch. What really stood out was how quiet and serene every space felt, despite being fully booked.

reviews.title: Absolutely a FANTASTIC time couldn't have been better!
reviews.review_text: Just got back from a fantastic time at the Peninsula Hotel in Paris. Everything was absolutely perfect. The place is beyond gorgeous and the staff is beyond anything I've experienced before. Everything and I mean everything about this place is great it's beautiful, it's a great location to see all the sites and the staff is as friendly as you could imagine. We went for our anniversary and boy did they treat us great... roses, candles, and chocolates it couldn't have been nicer . We'll be staying here every single time we go to Paris no need to look for anything else!

reviews.title: A wonderful break in Paris at a perfect hotel.
reviews.review_text:
We needed a break in Paris and chose the Peninsula with reliance on the high standards we have always had there. This trip met and exceeded the mark. The Peninsula is well stated elegance and cool and calm and serene with just enough edge of excitement.  The rooms are very nice and well supported by the technology that is part of their now standard array (we were at the new Peninsula in Istanbul in August and will provide a separate review). We were met at the door by Rana Martin form guest services and escorted to our room. The suite was nice and well appointed and very comfortable. A lovely selection of fruit and macrons awaited us and the flowers and appointments in the room were lovely and very proper and home. Rana is a gem in all respects.

The hallmark of The Peninsula has become its persons. Everyone greets you with a welcoming smile and treats you as an honored guest. The entire Concierge staff assisted with our flowers for our room and our challenging requests for restaurant reservations. This was handled by the entire team including Jeremie and Célia and Clotilde and Christophe (the entire very large and capable team is always happy and eager to be of assistance!). Pro traveler tip: get the WhatsApp contact to the Concierge Team and make your asks in real time and enjoy immediate and professional support before and during your stay. The service levels they provide are exactly why one stays at The Peninsula as they do everything with a smile and sense of pride that enhances the experience.

We caught up on much needed sleep at the hotel during our stay. It has been a long time since we traveled without our wonderful kids and the peace and quiet were spectacular. We enjoyed excellent room service breakfast daily and appreciated the highest quality linens and bedding and bath products. 

Thank you to the entire staff from front of house to housekeeping for a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: Glorious Hotel
reviews.review_text:
Fabulous hotel that’s been updated with a modern flair while still maintaining the stunning Parisian palace that it domiciles. The rooms have been incredibly soundproofed and designed with a comfortable elegance that is perfect for relaxing after a long day of perusing the streets. Additionally, the service is kind, helpful, and a delight. 

The only dings (and they’re small ones), are the firmness of the mattress, the tiny size of the gym, and, the Cantonese restaurant whose food is TERRIBLE. Also, if this is your first trip to Paris, it’s not in the most central location but the metro is so easy to navigate it shouldn’t matter.

reviews.title: Unworthy of a palace, terrible experience
reviews.review_text:
am deeply disappointed by my recent experience at the Peninsula Paris, supposedly the epitome of elegance and hospitality. I had chosen to go to the lobby while waiting for a friend, with the intention of having a drink right after. To my great surprise, I was simply “kicked out” of the lobby under the pretext that I was not drinking immediately and that I was not expecting anyone residing at the hotel.
People ask me who exactly I'm waiting for, what an indiscretion!
I have never been treated in such a humiliating manner in an establishment of this magnitude. I have gone very often to have breakfasts and even lunches in this establishment where I will never return, I will obviously tell my experience to other people around me
A man named SAÏD (I wonder how he was able to obtain such a position in charge of security) was arrogant, indelicate and disrespectful. I was made to feel like an unwanted intruder, even though I was planning to spend money at the hotel.
This behavior is unbecoming of a hotel of this reputation, and I strongly advise anyone not to go there if you expect a minimum of courtesy and professionalism. There are many other establishments in Paris that know how to treat their customers with respect and consideration, which is clearly not the case here.
Absolutely not worthy of a palace!

Generator Paris.address: 9-11 Place du Colonel Fabien, 75010 Paris France
Generator Paris.description: Generator Paris is a design-led hotel, offering both private and shared accommodations, located in the lively 10th district in Paris. Free WiFi access is available and it features a stylish lounge area with a games room. You can enjoy locally inspired dishes at the on-site Café Fabien and listen to DJ music while having a drink from the basement bar. Each of the contemporary rooms here provides air conditioning, bed linen, and a private bathroom with a shower. Some private twin rooms also offer a private terrace. A continental breakfast is prepared every morning, you will also find a 24-hour front desk, a laundry room, and a rooftop terrace as well as the shared lounge area.
Generator Paris.address_string: 9-11 Place du Colonel Fabien, 75010 Paris France

reviews.title: Practical place to stay in Paris
reviews.review_text: Though the place seemed to welcome some little maintenance after a long season, for me the place was good: I slept very well and had a good breakfast.

reviews.title: Feedback on Staff Attitude
reviews.review_text: The team isn’t friendly at all, especially the young man at the bar in the evenings. You really need to reassess the staff.

reviews.title: Hygiene of the hostel
reviews.review_text: the design and material were good, but the hygiene is bad. We traveled with three and two of the top bunk beds counter filled with candy wraps and grape stems. There's a big gap between the mattress and the beside has more other trash, spilled pink lip gloss that smells. it was a bit uncomfortable to fall asleep with the smell lol. I informed the front desk and they offered a full bed cleaning on my bunk bed but the bed was never cleaned..

reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviews.review_text:
SO many things wrong with this hostel. First, the staff were all so unfriendly, condescending, aggressive and SO rude. Secondly, the rooms were MANKY. There were stains ALL OVER our sheets, gum on the bed frames, nails on the floor and hair all under the pillows. The bathrooms were full of mold and again hair. The rooms were SO hot and humid ALL THE TIME and the AC wouldn’t work and the windows won’t open fully. 
Thirdly, the beds were incredibly uncomfortable and the pillows didn’t support our necks at all - we all woke up with sore necks and backs the next morning with barely any sleep. 
Fourthly, everything was VERY overpriced- 3€ for 500ml of water?? MAD. And 7.50€ to rent a towel?? HELLO??? 
I could name incidents that occurred when I stayed but I feel I could get into trouble if I mention them. But AVOID THIS HOSTEL AT ALL COST!!

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.review_text: We organized a quick visit to Paris with friends with children in tow. We found a structure with welcoming staff, with the reception always open and available to answer requests. The stay met expectations, the rooms are functional and clean. No annoying noises. I recommend booking at Generator Paris

Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile.address: 3 Place du General Koenig, 75017 Paris France
Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile.description: Standing 34 stories high, Hyatt Regency Paris Étoile offers breathtaking views of Paris and its iconic monuments. Ideally located between the business district of La Défense and the Champs-Élysées, this hotel is one of the largest in Europe, featuring 995 modern rooms and suites, all with stunning panoramic views. The hotel provides flexible event spaces, including 35 meeting rooms and one of the largest kitchens in Europe, ensuring tailored experiences for every guest. Guests have 24/7 access to a fitness center and Clés d’Or Concierges. The hotel also boasts Windo Skybar, the highest panoramic bar in the French capital, and Restaurant Mayo, which highlights local produce with a menu designed for sharing.
Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile.address_string: 3 Place du General Koenig, 75017 Paris France

reviews.title: Great place to stay in Paris
reviews.review_text:
Wonderful stay.  Nice friendly staff.  Regency club is great.  Nice to be able to have a glass of wine and relax after long day.  Breakfast spread is nice. 
Location is nice but some construction nearby causes delays with Taxi or Uber pickup/drop-offs.

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.review_text:
Once our taxi pulled up in the driveway, we needed help with our heavy suitcases. There was 2 employees standing around , talking and laughing amongst themselves. In the end I had to approach them for help.
We checked in, even though room pre paid , hotel asked for a deposit of euro 250. We happily obliged. I even inquired if it was ok to charge something from mayo. Answer: no problem .
The next morning bought a couple of croissant to be told , I was not allowed to charge to my room which was very embarrassing Luckily, I had cash in my pocket.
I asked reception for an explanation and received 3 different ones over the next 24 hours. The last version  was  that Euro 250, is not enough to cover the purchase of a couple of croissant. It only covers the cleaning fee, should you decide to smoke in a non smoking room. 
Needless to say that had they asked for more deposit, I would have happily obliged.
Upon entering the room, we noticed the safe was locked since previous guest, so we had to call security.
We woke up in the middle of the night, suffering from jet lag and decided to make a cup of tea. Unfortunately, tea bags had not been replenished since previous guest.
I decided instead to read in bed, this is when I noticed the bed lamp, above bedside, heavily covered in dust.
Spoke to a manager upon check out, but still feel very disappointed.
This is our 6th stay at the hotel, the last one being last July. We still love the hotel, the location and the brand. Not sure what happened since our last stay, but the service has dropped to what is now an unacceptably low level. It seems the ( very large) hotels focus on quantity at the expense of quality .
What a shame…

reviews.title: Great Paris Hotel easy access and great features!
reviews.review_text: This hotel is a great choice in Paris. As usual on a US to Europe flight we arrived early morning. They gave us  our room even though it was 10am!  It has a huge fabulous morning breakfast buffet (also common in a good European hotel) . It’s recognizable across the city scape as it’s the only tall building in that area. The metro (Porte Maillot)  is a block away from that Hyatt.   We did metro most of the time and a few times an Uber (never a taxi) when I was just too tired or for timing.  On our first day we had an “over view of Paris tour”. It included how to use the metro, buy tickets,  read that “spaghetti map” a walk around Notre Dame area and lots of helpful tips on having a great experience while touring Paris! It included  city etiquette-like how to read a restaurant, do I just sit down or ask for a table, tipping etc!  It was so helpful. This hotel is connect s to a true shopping mall (came in handy when we needed cold meds) and a convention center.  The new rail car system stop is a half block away, and  was being tested pre Olympics when we were there in March.  The hotel has bamboo keys and smart elevators. We did have a view of the tower from our room!  We did not select this hotel, it was part of a Paris to Normandy Viking cruise, and we were very happy there!

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.review_text: Room are clean, comfortable and relatively large compared to the average European hotel room. Although a little further out from most of the main Paris tourist attractions, still a great easily accessible location. Customer service was outstanding! Every employee was very kind and helpful.

reviews.title: Happy Family Time Spent at a Lovely Hotel
reviews.review_text:
Wonderful hotel! Excellent location. Helpful staff and lovely rooms with lovely views. Enjoyed Regency Club very much every morning. This is my 2nd stay here and will be my first choice whenever I come to Paris. 
Looking forward to the next stay with Hyatt Regency Etoile.

reviews.title: NOT BAD, COULD BE BETTER
reviews.review_text:
This is my first time staying at Citadine Tour Eiffel Paris, by Ascott Group.

The location of the hotel is very convenient, MRT metro station right in front of the hotel, McDonald + supermarkets + many restaurants around the hotel. The was a Sunday Morning Market under the train railway. We were so excited as that was the best way to see the local life and experience the local delicacy. 

My room was upgraded and was located at the corner, can enjoy the Eiffel Tower view at the living room. The living room is spacious. We also have a mini kitchenette too. So convenient to cook/reheat the food as there are stoves and microwave oven.

I love the water and coffee/tea dispenser machines at the lobby. Unlimited coffee/tea, hot chocolate, still & sparkling water are available 24hours. 

The lobby is not very big but it is cozy & modern + clean. You need to have keycard to access to the entrance from outside. Same goes to the guest floors access with keycard only for safety control.

When the train passing by, the vibration will notify you for every trip as the train railway just next to the hotel.

The whole staying experience can be enhanced further if we could feel the warm service + more cheerful smile to make us at ease, especially when we are travelling to a foreign country that we are not familiar with the local language, culture and environment. 

Warm service + friendly smile can earn another 2 stars to perfection for this stay!

reviews.title: Great family room
reviews.review_text: Very comfy family room, for our family of 4. Kids loved the free hot chocolate ma home in the foyer. I wish we’d spent the extra $1000AU and got the Eiffel Tower view for our 3 night stay. Maybe next time! Supermarket next door and plenty of eating options all around.

reviews.title: A estadia foi boa mas esperava mais de um hotel classificado como 4 estrelas
reviews.review_text:
Excelent location, close to the metro, bakeries and good restaurants and of course the Eiffel Tower
The lift has the floor cracked which makes a very bad impression since I was taking my husband in a romantic getaway. My stay was from Friday to Sunday and I didn’t get the room cleaned neither the towels and bed linens changed or even the trash was took away. The complimentary coffee downstairs didn’t have sugar almost all the time. The TV doesn’t have the option to mirror my cell screen, it is an important feature nowadays.

reviews.title: Wonderful Staff.  Excellent Location
reviews.review_text: Excellent location, within 15 minutes walking to the Eiffel Tower.   Our rooms have an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower.  It was a spectacular view at night, especially with the blinking lights of the Tower.   The bus stop and the metro line are in front of the hotel.  Tons of restaurants across the street.   The hotel staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions.

reviews.title: Lovely Stay
reviews.review_text: My wife and I were very satisfied with our stay at the Citadines Tour Eiffel. The front desk attendants were always courteous, patient and helpful (yes, they all spoke English). Our room was clean and comfortable. Very spacious. We didn't chose a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, which turned out to be a good choice for us  because once you leave the hotel, the Tower is in view from practically everywhere. A few quirks to be aware of; the key card needs to stay inserted in the room for the lights to work, and you must tap the key card to the motion sensor in the elevator or it won't go anywhere. Hopefully this tip will help others avoid our fate, which was to look like complete American idiots, pushing the button repeatedly to no avail until someone from the desk came to rescue us.  Our room was very quiet. There is an overhead train directly across the street. We could barely hear it, but we were on the other side of the building. I don't know if it is loud from the Eiffel-facing rooms. Of course, this was wonderful for getting around, as the Metro station is right across the street. There are a host of restaurants and shops in the neighborhood and the Eiffel Tower is within easy walking distance. Our only substantive criticism is that the air conditioning didn't keep the room very cool. It was in the 80's and humid during our stay, and the room was quite warm even with the air turned to the coldest setting. I imagine we'll have to get used to other countries being more energy conscious than the U.S. Overall, I would highly recommend Citadines Tour Eiffel!

Pullman Paris Eiffel Tower.address: 18 Avenue de Suffren 22 Rue Jean Rey Entrée Au, 75015 Paris France
Pullman Paris Eiffel Tower.description: Séjournez au Pullman Paris Tour Eiffel, l'hôtel préféré des voyageurs à Paris. Au pied de la Tour Eiffel, l'hôtel est le point de départ idéal pour visiter la capitale et ses principaux monuments. Offrant un grand confort et un excellent rapport qualité-prix, il propose un large éventail de services: réception ouverte 24 heures sur 24, conciergerie, room-service... Ses chambres spacieuses et lumineuses disposent d'une télévision à écran plat, d'une connexion Wifi, d'un minifrigo et d'une station d'accueil Alexa by Amazon. Certaines offrent une vue imprenable sur la Tour Eiffel. Rendez-vous au FRAME, sa brasserie française pour un brunch ou un diner et savourez les produits frais du jardin. Profitez également de la salle de fitness de l'hôtel et de ses équipements hi-tech. N'attendez plus pour réserver votre séjour au Pullman Paris Tour Eiffel et venez vivre une expérience immersive dans l'un des quartiers les plus prestigieux de Paris.
Pullman Paris Eiffel Tower.address_string: 18 Avenue de Suffren 22 Rue Jean Rey Entrée Au, 75015 Paris France

reviews.title: Great front desk staff, but really average housekeeping service
reviews.review_text:
Front desk staff was really friendly and professional. Shoutout to Charlotte & Jeff /Laurent for leaving us such a good impression of the hotel. My husband fell really sick on the 3rd night of the stay, and the front desk staff really tried their best to contact a local doctor to come over to the hotel (though unsuccessful), but they were prepared to send my husband to the nearest hospital if he needed. Applaud for the professionalism and the readiness to such medical emergencies. 

The hotel was also really sweet to give us a bottle of champagne, Cake & a sweet card to celebrate our anniversary! 

However, 1 thing to note was the poor room service. We had to ask for refill of amenities daily, which took really long each time to reach the room. and it got pretty frustrating, especially on nights when we were back from a long day. This was the main factor that contributed to what I felt was a average stay. To be also fair to the team, other than the amenities portion, the room is kept clean. 

Other than that, the hotel location is awesome. Right beside a couple of yummy cafes, Metro, and really close to the Eiffel Tower! There's also a little convenience store just right around the corner which we could also conveniently get ourselves little snacks.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.review_text: Great location right next to the Eiffel Tower, great view. The room was with a balcony which was an added bonus to see the Eiffel Tower. Great room plenty of space. The only thing on the downside was that the pillows were hard. But apart from that, highly recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Recent visit
reviews.review_text:
The location of this hotel is fantastic with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower.
The hotel front of house is modern, clean and presented really well.
The room we had was a superior room which was good in terms of size and fairly modern to be fair, the tea / coffee we had was poor with only one very small  milk carton, so we ended up purchasing coffee and milk from a local store.
The double bed was two singles pushed together.
The room service menu was poor and not much of a choice at all.

Breakfast is 35 euros irrespective if you wanted cooked breakfast or just a croissant / continental but for that you can have all types and as much as you like.

I would recommend staying in the week as it’s cheaper than weekends.

It was my wife’s 50th birthday which I did advise them at booking and not even a happy birthday at check in or nothing which I thought was poor.

I personally wouldn’t visit  this hotel again but the views of the Eiffel Tower from the room is superb, my advice book 1 night there and stay elsewhere for other nights.

Concierge staff at the front door were excellent 

Internet in the hotel says it’s free but I was charged 29.00 euros so be mindful.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.review_text:
We stayed here which was a great view from the balcony, the room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was amazing and this time has improved a lot as in the previous visit to Paris we always stayed here that is why we do know that it has improved but the disadvantages that could led to such a large issue are the communication and body language with the waiter because of the differences of language. 

Overall, great stay with a great location and view from the balcony but the accommodation was quite expensive.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text:
from checkin-to checkout everything was perfect. Especially desert in our room as welcome amenity was very delcious. 
Breakfast - Amazing breakfast. Restaurant is cozy and big enough to have perfect breakfast. Various and tasty selections for breakfast. You can have perfect start to your day
Location - Amazing. Its a bit away (30min walk) from Elysees but the walking way is along Seine is very nice/quite and plenty of things to discover about Paris. With taxi max 10min driving. But if you are fan of Eiffel - its the best location. From hotel to trocadero 10min nice walking way with perfect view.
Staff - Very helpfull. Especially Sarah GR manager and Stolic Tea who helped a lot. 
Room Size - I had deluxe room with balcony. Amazing room with Eiffel view and Size is perfect. You can relax there. 
Entertainment - No need to go outside for nice PAris evening - at least 2 nights. 1 nigt you can spend at top roof restaurant and enjoy Eiffel nioght view. and 2nd night in lobby restaurant where superb DJ is playing with cozy atmoshphere. Other nights you can go out ))
The only improvement area - in Deluxe room its not good to have  2 twin beds combined as King Bed)). Despite it did not affect lot, King bed itself makes big difference compare dto 2 twin beds combined as KING :)
Thanks Hotel team for their help in making my 5day trip to Paris relaxing and enjoyiable.

Shangri-La Paris Hotel.description: In the former home of Prince Roland Bonaparte, overlooking the Eiffel Tower and River Seine, ultimate Parisian elegance lives on in the French capital at Shangri-La Paris. This 19th century architectural gem has been listed in the French “Monuments Historiques” registry since 2009 and officially awarded the “Palace” status in 2014. Centrally located in the 16th arrondissement, minutes from the Champs-Elysées, the hotel blends European grandeur with traditional Asian hospitality. The hotel also boasts a 1 Michelin-starred restaurant, Shang Palace, along with seasonal dining experiences at the enchanting La Bauhinia.

reviews.title: Where Luxury Meets Genuine CareOFFICIAL
reviews.review_text: I've stayed in many hotels, but few have mastered the art of combining luxury with genuine warmth like this one. The staff remembered my name from day one, the amenities were thoughtfully selected, and the overall ambiance created a perfect blend of sophistication and comfort. The morning coffee service was exceptional, and the evening atmosphere in the lobby was perfectly ca

reviews.title: Cultural Charm with World-Class ServiceOFFICIAL
reviews.review_text: An absolute treasure! The architectural details alone are worth the stay, but it's the staff that makes this place truly special. Their genuine smiles and willingness to go the extra mile created countless memorable moments. The rooms are spacious and well-thought-out, with touches of local culture that add authentic charm.

reviews.title: Thoughtful Luxury with Perfect Balance
reviews.review_text: This place has mastered the perfect balance between luxury and comfort. The attention to detail was evident everywhere - from the perfectly pressed linens to the curated local recommendations from staff. The public spaces were vibrant yet maintained peaceful corners for quiet moments. The breakfast spread was exceptional, and the evening turndown service added a lovely touch to ea

reviews.title: Eiffel Tour View
reviews.review_text:
Just Perfect 
The Eiffel Tower view was the best
I believe it’s the best hotel in France and Paris
We will see you again next year the same month like this year
And the breakfast was super Spesial 
Finally we were very lucky to find this hotel to booking

reviews.title: Business Traveler's Dream Come True
reviews.review_text: As a frequent business traveler, I've seen my fair share of hotels, but this one truly stands out. The seamless check-in process, well-appointed rooms with ergonomic workspaces, and high-speed Wi-Fi made work a breeze. The 24-hour fitness center and in-room dining options catered to my unpredictable schedule. What really set this hotel apart was the staff's professionalism an

Disneyland Paris.description:
Welcome to the place where everyone can shine their brightest!

Since opening in 1992, Disneyland Paris® has welcomed hundreds of millions of guests through its gates, making it Europe's number-one tourist destination

With the majestic Sleeping Beauty castle as its heart, Disneyland park is the fantastical home to five incredible lands. For 30 magical years, it's been the place where extraordinary stories come to life before your very eyes. Buckle up because you’re about to whizz around Discoveryland, Fantasyland, Frontierland, Adventureland, and Main Street U.S.A.®

Feel unique magic in the air, as the 30th Anniversary festive aura transforms Disneyland park into a vibrant wonderland. With stunning surroundings, the mesmerizing Gardens of Wonder, and many eye-catching surprises, you're sure to get swept up in the celebratory spirit.

As night falls, prepare to be amazed by the award-winning Disney D-Light, where spectacular drone light choreography illuminates the sky.

reviews.title: Great Christmas Visit.
reviews.review_text: Really great time. Weather was snowing for the first day but cleared after that. Atmosphere was wonderful. Some areas were closed for refurbishment but it didn’t kill the atmosphere. We stayed in Newport Bay Hotel. Really recommend going at Christmas

reviews.title: We don't think about it to come back
reviews.review_text: First thing to make clear: Disneyland Paris is 2 connected parks, Disneyland Park and Walt Disney Studios Park. We only did the Disneyland Park. Visited on a hot summer day in July. As we rented a house in Esbly we were only 8 minutes away. We arrived before 10.00 and passing security and the entrance went smoothly. Then the wait started. You can see in the app and per attraction what the waiting time is. 1 - 2 hours of waiting is no exception. The park is nice and the attractions are great but waiting 2 hours for a 2 minute ride is not funny. We were with teenagers and focused on the rollercoasters but also did 'it's a small world', Alice's Curious Labyrinth, Autopia and the railroad. It was nice to sit for a while in a cool place during Mickey’s PhilharMagic. We have seen and experienced it and we don't think about it to come back. The hot temperature and long waiting lines aren't worth it. The price (we paid almost USD 80 per person with a Family and Friends ticket) is also not attractive to try it another time. Restaurants, food stands, and souvenir shops are also extremely expensive, but they think they can justify it because it's Disney. The crew we interacted with is also not friendly and looks stressed but what you imagine with these big crowds? When we wanted to fill our water bottles (they have some water fountains) a lady started shouting to us because it was the area for the disabled people to watch the parade. Way too much stress. We have seen it, it was a nice experience, but the long lines, high price and stressed crew doesn't attract us to come back.

reviews.title: Magic ... but some improvements are needed
reviews.review_text:
What I didn't liked and few improvements suggestions:
- Frozen themed events and attractions were missing. 
- Long waiting queues (particularly for meeting the characters and for the shows). 
- Very expensive souvenirs. 
- When is a bit windy the night show is not using the drones which makes the show a lot less spectacular... 
- The restaurants in the parks are closed in the evening 9most of them after 16:00) making it impossible to have dinner at a decent hour and then see the night shows (after the show is over - 22:00 is to late to grab dinner outside Disneyland Park because everything is closed so you end up starving in the night).
- After the night show the park is closing immediately so everybody is leaving the park at the same time making it very hard to get home with that huge crowd heading to the same busses/metro/shuttle stations.
